All loops are closed and the circles are the only elements in these loops. Since the "extrusion.sketch\\_scale" property is given as 0.75, scale the entire sketch by that ratio. Perform an extrusion with no depth towards the normal direction and a depth of 0.0268 opposite to the normal, following the values mentioned in the extrusion settings. Use the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" boolean operation to create a new solid body. Part 2 Now, we move on to the next part which is a slightly tapered cylindrical object. Create a new coordinate system with no rotation but with translation vector (0.0536, 0.0536, 0.0268). For this part, create a single face with only one loop consisted of a single circle element with center (0.3214, 0.3214) and radius 0.3214. As the sketch scaling factor is 0.6429, scale the entire sketch accordingly. This time, we perform the extrusion such that there is a depth of 0.2746 towards the normal direction and no depth opposite to the normal direction. Use the "JoinFeatureOperation" boolean operation to combine this new geometry with the previously constructed one. Final Shape The final shape consists of the first part - a donut-shaped object, and the second part - a slightly tapered cylindrical object. Remember the heights, widths and lengths of each part as well as the whole assembly according to the description provided in the JSON.</description>
